intro: Guettardella tenuiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered guettardella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is a small herbaceous plant characterized by its delicate, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. Native to tropical regions of South America, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The plant has a short stem with hairy surfaces and produces small, dry fruits that contain minute seeds. Its botanical features make it a notable species for study in tropical botany and ecological research.
